• Conas iarratas a dhéanamh
The Water Conservation Grant has been suspended for 2016
Tá Deontas nua Caomhnaithe Uisce á thabhairt isteach
It will not be paid for second homes or holiday homes. If you are a tenant, you will be paid the grant (if you registered by 30 June 2015) not your landlord
Chun cáiliú don deontas in 2015, ní mór gur chláraigh do theaghlach le hUisce Éireann faoin 30 Meitheamh 2015

The grant is administered and paid by the Department of Social Protection, on behalf of the Department of the Environment, Community and Local Government. Applications for the Water Conservation Grant 2015 are now closed

Féadfaidh tú do rogha úsáide a bhaint as an deontas, mar shampla, mar ranníocaíocht i dtreo do bhillí uisce, sceitheadh uisce a dheisiú, córas caomhnaithe uisce a shuiteáil, chothabháil a dhéanamh ar do thobar nó chun a sloda a bhaint ó d’umar seipteach
Further information is available on the Department of Social Protection website
Ní dhéanfar aon iniúchadh ar conas a úsáideann teaghlaigh an deontas
Every household that registered its principal private dwelling (main home) with Irish Water by 30 June 2015 is eligible for the Water Conservation Grant in 2015
Tá gach teaghlach a chláraigh a bpríomháit chónaithe (an príomhtheach) le hUisce Éireann faoin 30 Meitheamh 2015 incháilithe do Dheontas Caomhnaithe Uisce 2015 a fháil
If you registered after 30 June 2015 or have yet to register, you are not eligible for the grant in 2015
Má chláraigh tú i ndiaidh an 30 Meitheamh 2015 nó murar chláraigh tú go fóill, níl tú incháilithe don deontas in 2015
If you do not live in your principal private residence because of physical or intellectual disability, and your home is not rented to another person, you are eligible to apply for the grant
Tá an deontas iníoctha fiú má tá a seirbhísí féin príobháideacha soláthair uisce agus fuíolluisce ag an teaghlach agus mura custaiméir iad de chuid Uisce Éireann
The application process is an online one and there is no application form
Ní íocfar an deontas don dara teach nó do thithe saoire
People who do not have internet access can call the Water Conservation Grant Support team (see ‘Where to apply’ below) and they can make the application online on their behalf
Más tionónta thú, íocfar an deontas leat (má chláraigh tú faoin 30 Meitheamh 2015), seachas le do thiarna talún
The grant was €100 in 2015. It will be paid into your bank account
Beidh suim €100 i gceist leis an deontas in 2015
The grant is exempt from income tax
Conas iarratas a dhéanamh

Applications for the Water Conservation Grant 2015 are now closed. Between 18 August and the end of September 2015 all households that registered with Irish Water before 30 June 2015 got a letter from the Department of Social Protection explaining how to apply for the Water Conservation Grant
Scríobhfaidh an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí chuig teaghlaigh incháilithe ó Iúil 2015 ar aghaidh agus tabharfar cuntas ar an bpróiseas iarratais ar an deontas
The closing date for applications was Thursday 22 October 2015
Meastar go n-íocfar an deontas i Meán Fómhair 2015
You apply online at watergrant.ie
Is féidir níos mó faisnéise a léamh ar watergrant.ie
You will need the following information to apply for your Water Conservation Grant:
Cá háit a ndéanfaidh mé iarratas
• WPRN (Water Point Reference Number) - a number specific to your house, you will also find this on the letter from the DSP
Déanfaidh an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí, an deontas a riaradh agus a íoc thar ceann na Roinne Comhshaoil, Pobail agus Rialtais Áitiúil
If you have your own water supply and waste water services, you will have a registration number instead of an account number
Níl aon ghá teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an Roinn faoi láthair
